meta.name: Subject2
meta.content: A sweep at the Grammys. A Diamond Jubilee. A devastating hurricane. All that, plus spectacular moments in politics, sports and world news, captured in this special section.

body.head.abstract: A sweep at the Grammys. A Diamond Jubilee. A devastating hurricane. All that, plus spectacular moments in politics, sports and world news, captured in this special section.

body.content.photo.caption: JANUARY Giglio Island, Italy The wreck of the Costa Concordia cruise ship, which ran aground on a reef and finally came to rest near shore on Jan. 14, killing 32 and injuring more than 60 (Reuters)
JANUARY Frankfurt, Germany A penguin goes for a swim in a zoo (Michael Probst/AP)
FEBRUARY Pittsburgh The Penguins’ Evgeni Malkin stretches before an NHL game against the Tampa Bay Lightning (Gene J. Puskar/AP)
FEBRUARY Los Angeles Singer Adele at the 54th Grammy Awards, winning in each of six categories she was nominated (Lucy Nicholson/Reuters)
Karachi, Pakistan A labourer works at a small foundry, earning about $5.15 a day (Fareed Khan/AP)
MARCH Harrison, Tenn. Tornadoes cut through the Midwest from Texas up through the Great Lakes (Billy Weeks/AP)
March New Delhi A Tibetan exile protests a visit from Chinese President Hu Jintao to India (reuters)
London Catherine, duchess of Cambridge, plays hockey with Team GB at the Riverside Arena in the Olympic Park (Chris Jackson/Reuters)
APRIL Pyongyang, North Korea A choir sings during a concert to commemorate the 100th anniversary of the birth of Kim Il Sung (david guttenfelder/ap)
APRIL Pakistan A group of men in the Malakand district, northwest of Islamabad, use rope to right a supply truck overloaded with straw (mian khursheed/reuters)
MAY Kandahar, Afghanistan A U.S. Army private takes cover during a controlled detonation to clear an area to set up a checkpoint (Shamil Zhumatov/Reuters)
MAY Vietnam Ducks on their way to a market in Ha Nam province, outside Hanoi (nguyen huy kham/ reuters)
Somalia African Union soldiers before they advance on a town west of Mogadishu to fight al-Shabaab militants (stuart price/reuters)

JUNE London Prince William and his wife, Kate, board a ship to watch a Diamond Jubilee flotilla of more than 1,000 vessels on the Thames River, the largest such event in 350 years (uK Press/KEYSTONE Press)
JUNE Niagara Falls, Ont. Daredevil Nik Wallenda, the ‘King of the Wire,’ halfway through his 25-minute tightrope walk over the Falls (Frank Gunn/CP)
Sicamous, B.C. A local state of emergency is called after the area is inundated by heavy rain, flooding and mudslides (JONATHAN HAYWARD/CP)
JULY Pamplona, Spain A participant is tossed during the running of the bulls of the San Fermin festival (Daniel Ochoa de Olza/AP)
JULY Glen Allen, Va. Barack Obama steps up his campaigning as polls showed a tight presidential race with Republican Mitt Romney (JASON REED/REUTERS)
Ottawa Prime Minister Stephen Harper at the Canada Day celebrations (steve simon)
AUGUST New York City Carly Rae Jepsen sings Call Me Maybe to young fans for NBC’s Today show (Brendan McDermid/Reuters)
AUGUST Bucharest, Romania A bride poses for the camera at the Arch of Triumph after being ‘kidnapped’ on her wedding night (Vadim Ghirda/AP)
London Gabrielle Douglas of the U.S. on the balance beam during the women’s individual gymnastics final at the North Greenwich Arena (Dylan Martinez/Reuters)
AUGUST London Canada’s Jennifer Abel and Émilie Heymans in mid-dive during the women’s synchronized 3-m springboard final (julia vynokurova/getty images)
AUGUST London Jamaica’s Usain Bolt crosses the finish line ahead of the pack to win gold in the men’s 100-m final at the Olympic Stadium (david j. phillip/ap)
SEPTEMBER Democratic Republic of the Congo The Lesula monkey is only the second new species of African monkey discovered in 28 years (reuters)
SEPTEMBER Sivakasi, India People run for cover as smoke rises from the site of a blaze at a fireworks factory, which killed 52 people (ap)
Montreal New Quebec Premier Pauline Marois is led off the stage during her victory speech, interrupted by a shooting in the building (Paul chiasson/cp)

OCTOBER Above Roswell, N.M. Austrian Felix Baumgartner, 43, became the first skydiver to go faster than the speed of sound, reaching a velocity of 1,342 km/h when he jumped out of a balloon 39 km above New Mexico. He also smashed the record for the highest-ever freefall. (UPPA)
OCTOBER Hoboken, N.J. Taxis sit in a flooded lot in the wake of hurricane Sandy (Michael Bocchieri/Getty images)
OCTOBER Union Beach, N.J. A house damaged by hurricane Sandy, one of the most destructive natural disasters to ever hit the U.S. Northeast (eric thayer/reuters)
Seaside Heights, N.J. Waves break against a crumpled roller coaster at an amusement park destroyed by the storm (Mario Tama/GETTY IMAGES)
NOVEMBER Chicago Michelle and Barack Obama celebrate the presidential victory with Vice President Joe Biden and his wife, Jill (Chris Carlson/AP)
NOVEMBER Los Angeles Jenny McCarthy kisses Justin Bieber as he accepts an award at the American Music Awards (Danny Moloshok/Reuters)
DECEMBER Kenya The nomadic Maasai people register to vote using biometric computer equipment to decrease chance of fraud (CARL DE SOUZA/AFP/Getty Images)
The Philippines Rescuers evacuate survivors of typhoon flooding that killed 332 people and left hundreds more missing (Erik de Castro/Reuters)
DECEMBER Glasgow, Scotland More than 1,000 people take part in the annual five-kilometre Glasgow Santa Dash (jeff j. mitchell/getty)
